oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Voltage dependent anion channel (VDAC) of mitochondria plays a crucial role in apoptosis. Human VDAC-1, reconstituted in planar lipid bilayer showed reduced conductance when treated with curcumin. Curcumin interacts with residues in the alpha helical N-terminus of VDAC and in the channel wall, as revealed by molecular docking, followed by mutational analysis. N-terminus mimicking peptide showed conformational changes in circular dichroism, upon curcumin treatment. We propose that the interaction of curcumin with amino acids in N-terminus and in channel wall fixes the alpha helix in closed conformation. This restricts its movement which is required for the opening of the channel. (C) 2014 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
